column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.DemoNERRE|NamedentityTags
#T_RL=webanno.custom.DemoRE|NamedentityRelations|BT_webanno.custom.DemoNERRE
#Text=A polycrystalline sample of GdPd3 was synthesized by arc-melting the stoichiometric amount of highly pure
#Text=(≥ 99.9%) constituent elements under argon followed by vacuum annealing for 240 h at 1000 °C (ref. 28).
#Text=Powder
#Text=x-ray diffraction data taken at room temperature (see Figure-1 of Supplemental material) and their Rietveld
#Text=refinement49 suggest that the synthesized compound is a single phase and is free from any detectable impurity50.
#Text=The refined value of the cubic lattice parameter a is 4.0919(4) Å.
#Text=Temperature- and magnetic field-dependent
#Text=electrical transport measurements were carried out using the four-probe technique in a Quantum Design Physical
#Text=Properties Measurement System (PPMS) equipped with a 3He refrigeration system.
#Text=The MR data do not show any
#Text=significant dependence on the relative orientation between the current direction and H.
#Text=Heat capacity Cp(T) was
#Text=measured by relaxation measurement in the PPMS.
#Text=The temperature dependence of χ and field dependence of
#Text=the magnetization M was measured in a Quantum Design Magnetic Properties Measurement System (MPMS).
#Text=The χ(T) data were taken in both zero-field-cooled (ZFC) and field-cooled (FC) conditions at the lowest field
#Text=H =  0.01 T.
#Text=Since the ZFC and FC data overlap with each other in the entire T range of the measurement at this H,
#Text=the data at higher H’s were taken only in the ZFC condition.
#Text=The overlapping ZFC and FC data suggest that our
#Text=sample is free from blocking and pinning effects.
